alert.note: Alert for Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 2:37PM EDT until July 16 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Guilford County in central North Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, McLeansville, Jamestown, Lake Jeanette Marina, Lake Brandt, Lake Townsend, Lake Townsend Marina, Monticello, Oak Hollow Marina and Colfax. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
